section.name: Test Plan
section.subsection:
This test plan document for the project "Jake" should cover the following goals:
Definition of used terms
Identification of the components to be tested
requirements for the tests
list of tests to be performed
description of the test strategy

Beside the terms used and defined in the section "Components" we use the follwing terms:
Test case / Unit test
A Test case is a java file that tests a specified aspect (unit) of a component of a program.
test driven development
Is a method of creating software. The idea is to specify what interface a component has, write a test case for each aspect of the interface and only after that, create an implementation of that interface.
Test suite
A test suite is a batch of corresponding test cases.
Data Access Object
We encapsulate all the logic needed to manipulate data (e.g. Database records, files in the filesystem) with so called Data Access Object. Therefore we can later easily change the way we read or write data to disk (e.g. changing the database backend) without altering the rest of the code.
Project Root Folder
TODO

Our Project consists of the following components.
# Component
Name
Component Description Priority
1.
GUI
The Graphical User Interface
Very High
2.
Core
The Core Component - Contains the business logic of the program, supplies interfaces for (graphical) user interfaces and communicates with the other components
Very High
3.
Filesystem
Filesystem Service - Used to handle the whole file and filesystem based logic
Very High
4.
Sync Synchronisation Service - Mock Object simulating the Synchronisation between Clients
Medium
5.
ICS InterClient Communication Service - Mock Object simulating the communications between clients and the network
Medium
Child Components:
Parent
Component
Child Component Priority Ticket#

GUI CreateProjectGUI Very High [none yet]
GUI MainView Very High [none yet]
GUI ViewLogGUI Medium [none yet]

GUI ResolveConflictsGUI High [none yet]

GUI SearchObjectGUI High #103
GUI PreferencesGUI - Push/Pull Behaviour High #104
GUI PreferencesGUI - Networking Options Very High #105
GUI ImportFileFolderGUI Very High [none yet]
GUI PropagateChangesDialog High [none yet]

body.section:
Types of test-cases:
FC = Failure Test Case
NC = Normal Test Case
SC = Special Test Case
The User is presented with a login form, where he has to enter credentials to login
Preconditions:
The Program is started
A Project is in the process of being opened
The user is not yet authenticated
Test-Case# Function Expected result Inputs Achieved Result Error Behaviour Passed? Priority Type
1 User credentials go to authentication service ICS returns logged in or not Username: domdorn@jabber.fsinf.at
Password: somepassword
Very High NC
2 User enters invalid characters in input Incorrect fields are highlighted somehow Username: 3ds##@(@)!@*%$ Passwort: #(@"^%
Very High FC
3 User enters invalid Username without @ Username field is highlighted Username: someusernamewithout_at_
Very High FC
4 User enters no password Submit button not clickable, Password field highlighted Username: "some.valid@username.com"
Password: ""
Very High FC
5 User enters invalid credentials User gets informed of invalid credentials, Username and Password fields get cleared Username: domdorn@jabber.fsinf.at
Password: wrongpassword
Very High NC
6 User enters no Username Submit button not clickable, Username field highlighted Username ""
Password: something
High FC
The User is presented a dialog, where he can create a new Project
Preconditions:
The Program is started
No Project is opened
The user is not yet authenticated
Test-Case# Function Expected result Inputs Achieved Result Error Behaviour Passed? Priority Type
7 Projectname empty Create button disabled, field highlighted Projectname: ""
Very High FC
8 Projectfolder not selected Create button disabled, field highlighted
Very High NC
9 Projectfolder invalid Error Message "This Projectfolder is not allowed by your Operating system" is shown, Projectfolder field cleared Projectfolder: C:\:COM1
Very High FC
10 Existing JakeProject Project root folder is selected Error Message "There is already a Jake Project in this folder. Please select another folder for this project" Project root folder: /home/username/jakeprojects/existingproject
Very High FC
11 Projectname to short or to long in comparision to assumptions Error Message "Invalid Projectname! Your project name needs to be at least X and at most Y characters long, consisting of the characters a-zA-Z, underscore '_' and hyphen '-' " Projectname: someveryveryveryvyervyervyerlongnamewithinv@lidchar$init
Very High FC
The User is presented the main view of the program, where he can switch between the various views.
Preconditions:
The Program is started
A project is selected
The user is authenticated
Test-Case# Function Expected result Inputs Achieved Result Error Behaviour Passed? Priority Type
12 Close Application The Project is closed, all aquired resources are freed.
Very High NC
13 Switch views The User clicks on a tab to switch the current view
Very High NC
14 Resize window The User uses his mouse to resize the window, all window elements are moved accordingly
Medium NC
The User can view the log entries of the whole project or certain objects.
Preconditions:
The Program is started
A project is selected
The user is authenticated
The ViewLog View is open
Test-Case# Function Expected result Inputs Achieved Result Error Behaviour Passed? Priority Type
15 Display the projects log entries The LogEntries are shown to the user
Very High NC
16 No LogEntries available Error Message "Something is wrong with your database because no log entries exist. There should exist at least one log entry stating the project exists" is shown.
Very high FC
17 Show LogEntries of selected object from other views Only the corresponding LogEntries for the selected object(s) are shown the selected JakeObject
Very High NC
18 Show LogEntries of select object, but there aren't any Error Message "There's something wrong with your database, because no log entries of this object are available!" the selected JakeObject
Very high FC
The User can read a message sent to him.
Preconditions:
The Program is started
A project is opened
The user is authenticated
The Project is synchronized
Test-Case# Function Expected result Inputs Achieved Result Error Behaviour Passed? Priority Type
19 The User uses his mouse to resize the windows The Window is resized, the corresponding elements are moved, the textarea gets enlarged.
High NC
20 The User indicates to close the window The Window is closed, the MessageObject is deleted.
Very High NC
21 The User indicates to make a reply for this message The window is closed, a compose window is opened
Medium NC
The User can send messages to other members.
Preconditions:
The Program is started
A project is opened
The user is authenticated
Test-Case# Function Expected result Inputs Achieved Result Error Behaviour Passed? Priority Type
22 No Recipient/Message given Error Message: "You must specify an recipient / a message content beforce you can send this message"
Very High FC
23 No Falid Recipient Error Message: "There is no such projectmember. Please check your typing" Recipient: nosuch@projectmeber.com
Very High FC
24 All Inputs correct Message is sent through ICS, no exception thrown
Very High NC
25 Message Content to long Error Message: "Messages are only allowed to have a maximum length of XX chars." A too long message content
Medium FC
26 Message contains nonprintable characters beside \r\n The nonprintable characters are removed from the message Messagecontent: nonprintable characters, e.g. \0
Medium SC
The User can see a list of available notes

The Program is started
A project is opened
The user is authenticated

28 No notes available The List is empty. A small label before or below the list tells that there are no notes yet.
High NC
29 Error Parsing a Note A note could not be parsed correctly. The corresponding line in the list is highlighted so that the user see's the problem, can open the note and correct the parsing problem List of Notes with at least one with invalid data
Medium fc
30 Sort notes by creator, date, etc. By clicking on the label of a column, the list is sorted ascendenting or descendenting on that column List of Notes
Medium NC

section.name: Test Types
section.subsection: We're using unit tests based on the JUnit Testing Framework in the current version (4.4). We want to ensure, that the component is doing what we expect it to do, before writing the component itself (test driven development)
We're currently not planing on testing the user interface, although we're evaluating using test-driven development for the user interface.
The Data Access Objects are tested with unit tests. Therefore we can assure, the components are working correctly if the database and filesystem service behind them is working correctly.
We're not doing any performance testing. If we encounter performance problems during the tests, those will be noted.
We're not doing any load testing because the project is not intended for high load situations.

We're not doing any stress testing because the project is not intended for high stress situations. The only component which could be vulnerable to high stress is the InterClient Communication Service. Because this component is not implemented during this project phase, no stress tests are required.
Because all Users of the systems have the same privileges, no security tests are planed to be performed except testing the ICS for correct login/logout of a user.
Because all Users of the systems have the same privileges, no permission tests are planed to be performed.

ol.li:
Unit Testing
We're using the JUnit Testing Framework for unit testing.
http://www.junit.org

Mock Objects
We're planing on using JMock for creation of Mock objects.
http://www.jmock.org

GUI Testing
Althought we're not planing testing the GUI, we'll try do test-driven development of the GUI using FEST
http://code.google.com/p/fest/

Test Report Generation
We're using the Surefire-Report Plugin included in the Maven build management suite.
http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/

ul.li: Because we're using "test driven development" all tests should be created before the implementation of the specific interface.
The person responsible for the specific component/interface is responsible for creating the test suites.
The test delegate (Dominik Dorn) will occasionally check some of the test suites for quality and coverage and assigns tasks for the responsible person to correct the issue.
Code reviews of the created sourcecode (not the tests) will be performed. Eventually found possible errors will be handled like described in the following section "Error Reporting".

body.section:
When an error is found:
An test case should be created by the person found the error with a short description of the circumstances causing the error, the input data and the expected output. A small test case, showing the input data should be created to show the problem to others.
A bug in our bugtracking tool (flyspray) has to be opened and to be assigned to the person responsible for the specific component. The name of the test case should be noted.
The ticket number received by the bugtracking tool should be noted in the test case.
This document has to be updated, adding the error to the list of test cases.
The changes have to be commited to our svn repository.
If the bug or the corresponding test case would be to big, to create a small test case in a reasonable amount of time, an empty test case should be created, including a comment to reproduce the error. The person responsible for the code in question then has to create the full test case.

When a programmer becomes assigned to a bug, he/she has to
Set the tickets status to "assigned"
Create the rest of the unit test
Fix the specified code in the codebase of the component
Test the unit case, redo (3) if necessary
Make sure that the unit test is included in every new build of the component
Close the ticket

tr.td: Added Testcases, restructured Document, Added additional fields.
